text: Madhuca microphylla is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is endemic to Sri Lanka, where it has been found in only two locations.World Conservation Monitoring Centre. 1998. Madhuca microphylla. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 1998. Downloaded on 18 September 2015. ==References== Category:Endemic flora of Sri Lanka microphylla Category:Endangered plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Madhuca microphylla
